headline: Classic Macaroni Salad
description: This creamy macaroni salad with bell pepper, carrots, celery, and pimento peppers is a real crowd-pleaser at every cookout, potluck, and picnic!

video.description: See how to make a classic macaroni salad.
video.name: Classic Macaroni Salad

name: Classic Macaroni Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 green bell pepper, seeded and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Rinse under cold water and drain.
Mix mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, mustard, salt, pepper, and macaroni together in a large bowl.
Stir in celery, onion, green pepper, carrot, and pimentos.
Refrigerate salad for at least 4 hours before serving, but preferably overnight.

review.reviewBody: My family really enjoyed this alongside a French dip and tossed green salad. I didn’t have pimento. I did use a red onion which I would mot next time as It gave off a strong taste the longer the salad set.
Excellent flavor! My husband wants it all the time now. The dressing seems to be perfect for coleslaw and potato salad as well.
Really good recipe. I read the reviews and decreased the sugar. I didn't have pimento. I added a red and yellow pepper. Nice taste and smooth dressing.

As regards the sugar and salt: both are excellent flavour enhancers. The sugar called for here though, is desert-level madness! At just under half the called for amount, the sweetness will blend into the background. So 1/4 cup of sugar gets the job done and gets out of the way. 1/3 cup isn't a deal breaker, but anything more and you will be tempted to put whipped cream on it and serve it with tea. As for the salt, I'd recommend starting at 1 tsp. Unlike the sugar, you can always add a little more salt after the salad has cured overnight. And about that overnight cure... it really isn't optional. This is one of those dishes that is completely different after it has rested. I give 1 star ratings wherever the basics are wrong, but as others have noted, once you correct course this recipe is a great starting place to feature whatever fresh herbs/veggies are growing around you.

Joined the Bereavement Committee at Church and was immediately drafted into food prep. Made this recipe and it very popular. Based on the reviews I read I cut back on the sugar but I've made it 3 times now and each time I keep increasing the sugar a little. Currently at 3 tablespoons, but still may increase it next time. There is a perfect blend between the vinegar and the sugar. I'm going to find it! After a funeral Mass we have a buffet out for the family and friends of the deceased. We are privileged to offer them some comfort in our cooking and baking. This salad was such a winner that it was requested I do this dish again. Thank you allrecipes!
Just the way I like it added sweet gerkinspickles and juice
I followed the recipe exactly and it was amazing.
My go-to macaroni salad recipe, skipped pimento, light and refreshing tasting.
As with every recipe, I use my best judgement when adding ingredients, ie recipe calls for twice as much sugar that's needed, so I halved the amount. Voila! Delicious.

This is definitely a traditional take on macaroni salad. it reminds me of macaroni salad I’ve purchased in a deli before. I would recommend cutting the sugar in half or adding a tablespoon at a time and tasting it because I found the finished product to be way too sweet. If you run into the same problem I did, I ended up squeezing a fresh lime into it and adding more mayo and mustard to cut the sweetness. I also added two chopped hard boiled eggs to cut the sweetness.

TOTALLY RUINED! That was disgusting! What a waste of food & time spent. I made a HUGE mistake by not reading MORE reviews first. Sugar content is WAY TOO HIGH. In fact, sugar has NO BUSINESS in a macaroni salad, NEVER, EVER. I will not EVER add sugar to macaroni salad AGAIN. YUK! YUK! YUK!

I change the recipe completely, very little mayo, no sugar, no vinegar and replace all the vegetables by just using English peas and add hard boiled egg and bitesize lean ham or crunchy bacon pieces. Then I would call it a Classic Macaroni Salad!
Very Good. Made it several times.
This is great! Reminded me of my grams and it’s salad I just seasoned to my liking…In reading everyone’s preferences, I didn’t substitute the green pepper for an orange…must be an east coast thing!?!

Yes the recipe is a crowd pleaser BUT pay heed to the reviews! I only used 2 TB on sugar and it was STILL too sweet. I am cutting the sugar more next time! And I did not have the pimentos so I added chopped green olives with pimentos and a little bit of the brine! Definitely cut the sweet. And I used red & orange peppers - again - for flavor, crunch AND visual. A great addition! Need to go back and look at my pasta box! I used a whole box and I think I should measure 4 cups - wanted a little more sauce. Will make again!
I made this recipe but halved it. I didn't have green bell pepper so used orange. I didn't opt for the carrots or pimento. Delicious and delightful. Next time I make it, I'll reduce the sugar more.

This recipe is fantastic, tasted it when I finished mixing. WOW, can't wait for it to get cold. I did make a couple of changes, i used celery salt instead of just salt, left the green pepper and pimento out. I am not a fan of them.
I get requests for this everytime we have a summer church social or large gathering.
I read the reviews first, 1/4 cup of sugar and rinsing the pasta in cold water makes this perfect!!! Best pasta salad recipe I’ve ever made!

My experience with this recipe was good although I had to make changes. I didn't need so much, so I halved the recipe. Also, I would never put that much sugar into food that's normally savory. With the recipe halved, I only put in one tablespoon sugar, and then, after tasting at the end, about another two tablespoons (otherwise too vinegary for my taste). I didn't have pimentos, plus I forgot I'd just had to clean out my produce drawer, so I didn't even have celery or a carrot. I could only refrigerate the salad for about half an hour before we ate. Even with all these changes, the macaroni salad tasted great. My husband agreed.

Have made this a couple times now. As written, it's too sweet. 3 tbsps is plenty for the full recipe. I also use half mayo half yogurt to save on calories. I always halve the recipe and it's more than enough for two people. This is delicious and my favorite mac salad.

I loved this macaroni salad but ONLY after some changes to the recipe. First, the amount of sugar the recipe calls for is wayyyy too much. I used 1/4 cup (4 tablespoons) and while it's delicious I think next time I'll only use 3 tablespoons sugar and adjust from there if needed. This is a great base recipe as you can really customize it to your liking. I added some capers for a little salty brininess and some chopped up sweet pickles. Also added some chopped hardboiled eggs and garlic powder and paprika. Didn't add the carrots or red peppers. DELICIOUS!

Wow, I couldn't stop eating this salad. Definitely adjust to your taste. I read other reviews and only added 1/4c of the sugar and also cut the vinegar by half. I don't really like the idea of putting so much mustard so I only put 1/2 T plus 1tsp in mine. My guests asked for the recipe. This is a salad you want to make a day before so that the dressing is not so runny. Once it cools, it's creamy and delicious. Loved it--will make again and again.

I liked this recipe, except I added 3 diced, boiled eggs, about 1/4 cup of sliced black olives, and 1/2 of a large chopped dill pickle. So, it was more like my homemade potato salad. I would probably not use as much sugar next time, because it was a bit too sweet for my taste. But overall, not bad!

With some trepidation , due to the reviews, I made this primarily as it is written. I did not use onion because my hubby doesn't eat raw onion. No pimentos either because I don't like them. The rest of the recipe was exactly as written. We loved the flavor. I added extra veggies (peppers, celery, carrots) because I try to sneak in as many veggies as I can. I was concerned about the consistency of the sauce but we allowed it to refrigerate for four or five hours before eating and in that time it had thickened up considerably. This will be our new macaroni salad recipe. Thanks for sharing with us!
Great flavor! I used cellentani pasta and only 1/3 cup sugar. Also used some garlic powder and did not use bell pepper or pimento. Perfect accompaniment to our BBQ.

Made this according to recipe. As expected, lots of prep --I like my onions and peppers and celery chopped very fine. But it was worth it. I was afraid it would have too much onion, but it turned out just great. Needs a little more of the dressing, however, as it was a little drier than I prefer. Note to vegetarians: add little cubes of very firm tofu (pressed dry) and you have a main dish. The salad needs a full day to marinate.
Easy recipe with a great taste! After mixing seems yellow and sweet but both settle after chilling. I did add some lemon juice to dilute the sweet

I like the ratio of pasta to veggies however the dressing is much too sweet for my liking. I also did not care for the addition of prepared mustard. Next time I will substitute Dijon and cut the sugar by at least half.
My husband loved it.
This is a fantastic pasta salad, the only draw back I have found is that now I am required to bring a big bowl to every family gathering no matter the season or holiday!
This is an excellent macaroni salad recipe. I made it the day before we ate it. The flavors were blended nicely. The only change I made was to use between 1/8th and 1/4 cup less sugar.
Good, classic macaroni salad. I skipped the pimento peppers.

Let it marinate together over night. STIR STIR STIR! It will come out perfect I've made this quite a few times at this point. First few rounds I stuck to the recipe exactly how it calls for. I really wouldn't do anything different except adding more carrots for the crunch. I used carrot chips. I added 3 heavy table spoons of roasted red peppers and it doesn't look noticeable so I may or may not add more in the future. Stick to the recipe exactly as it calls. I have gotten so many compliments and requests for it. STIR STIR STIR.. Stir it around after making and before serving. The macaroni absorbs the liquids so stir it. It will be perfection.

I always end up adding more mayo because once it settles it's not very creamy, but very good maybe a bit sweet I add relish too so that maybe why. But a great recipe that you can customize to your family's liking.

Really liked this recipe and made very little adjustments! Like many others, I cut down on the sugar by half, and added in a jalapeno pepper for a little sweet and spicy kick. Adding it to my recipe book!
Great ! no changes
Easy and delicious
Not bad, but way too much sugar. 1/4 cup is still too sweet. It’s not desert.
It was a little too sweet. I added a little bit extra vinegar , salt and mayonnaise and it was delicious. Next time I will add a little less sugar.
Great except way too much sugar. Decrease that to 2 tablespoons and you have a great recipe.
I thought it was too much sugar in the recipe and should have adjusted down by 75%...WAY TOO SWEET.
Add black olives and paprika and a little bit more mayonnaise and if I want add some pickles either regular or sweet and spicy

it was good but with a few changes: 1. i used the tiny elbows 2. i will cut sugar from 2/3 cup to 1/2 3. i will use less mustard 1 tbl 4. i used red onion for color 5. no pimento 6. red bell pepper 7. 1/2 cup shredded carrot 8. sliced egg on top
This is the closest to my Mother's! Hers was always the best!

Very good. I made some small changes. I reduced the amount of sugar, based on other’s reviews to 1/2C. I also used only 1 Tbls. of mustard, and I only had one medium sized carrot, so I finely grated that. I didn’t have pimentos. Although I think that would have been good. It has a nice, tangy taste.
The sugar is definitely unnecessary. I left out the sugar, added some black olives, and I used vegan mayo. It came out great! Delicious and my family loved it. Leave out the sugar!

This is a great recipe if you cut back the sugar. I use a 1/4 cup of sugar and comes out just right for me and my family. I also sprinkle some salary seed on top of the macaroni salad then I mix it up right before serving. I would give it five stars if didn't call for so much sugar.
I reduced the sugar to 2 tablespoons and it was still too sweet. I added more mayonnaise and some smashed hard boiled eggs to make it edible.
When I make my salad,I use bow tie pasta , I add shredded carrots, celery, onion, eggs , sweet pickles, some juice, sugar, salt pepper some mustard not much. Sweeten up Mayo with sugar,

I make my potato salad this way, I omit the sugar completely, I used cider vinegar. To prevent macaroni from clumping added just a small amount of oil olive. I use whipped dressing instead of mayo. Naturally I had to taste while still warm, it will be better once cooled and flavors blended. I omitted, well actually I forgot to add mustard. It depends on your taste. I don't think it needs mustard. I also omitted carrots, never had this recipe with carrots in it, so it did not appeal to me.
My family enjoyed it, but next time I will use half the sugar and a little more mustard.

This is one of the best recipes I found so far but made a few changes - I used less sugar and little less vinegar, I also replaced the green bell pepper with red bell pepper. I added a little more mayo and about a 1/4 cup of sour cream. Instructions say to chill for at least 4 hours and actually taste even better chilled longer (the next day)!
Love this recipe. Did include carrots or pimientos, it turned out great.

Update 2/22- Made this recipe again. Still used a little less sugar and doubled the dressing recipe. Used a little extra mayo and mustard to offset the taste of the vinegar. Added chopped shredded carrots, chopped celery and sliced black olives! Delicious! I doubled this recipe for a 4th of July BBQ. I used 1.5 boxes of elbow macaroni and doubled the sauce part. I only used 1/2 cup sugar total for the 2x recipe. I also added a little extra mayo and mustard, as it seemed a little vinegary to me. I didn't add the pimento peppers or green peppers. I used celery, green onions, sliced black olives and chopped shredded carrots. It was so freaking good! It tastes better if you make it the night before too.
I and my family loved this!

i loved this receipe it was perfect the flavors, texture were so flavorable and delicious. Making it again for Thanksgiving

No flavor to be had at all and definitely not a classic Macaroni salad. I should have known by the picture alone because the classic macaroni salad has much more liquid to it. This one is the most driest macaroni salad I've seen in all my life.

Going by other people's reviews, it seems like I made the right choice in reducing the flavor but I almost would have prefered to taste overpowering sweetness than a light vinagar paste.
this was great

Also added 1 tbsp granulated garlic, 1 of onion powder and 1 1/2 paprika - would lower next time to 1/2 tbsp and 2 tbsp of dill pickle relish and 6 boiled eggs diced. also took suggestion and did 3/4 cup of mayo and 1/4 sour cream. I added none of the diced veggies (cause didn't have) and thought it came out great minus the mildly heavy paprika - was going for a deviled egg salad and came really close.
I didn’t use as much sugar, and it was delicious

I let it set over night and the dressing was completely absorbed- perfect for his liking. He absolutely loved this recipe. HOWEVER, he did say I could cut back on the sugar WHEN I make it again. This recipe is AMAZING!!! Today I made it for the second time and it's even better then I remembered the first time I made it.
I could eat this everyday.

Thank you

People, you need to put this in the fridge overnight!! I did the EXACT recipe and put in the fridge overnight and it was absolutely perfect. My mother said it was better than her recipe that everyone loves.
Do not try and serve this right away. I feel sorry for all of the people who threw theirs out. Fridge it!!
It turned out so sweet and I put less sugar than called for. We just didn't care for it.
The sugar, half the salt, avocado mayo.

This is absolutely gross! If you like candy Mac salad this is the one for you. I added half the sugar it asked for and followed every other direction as the recipe states. I wouldn’t serve this to my worst enemy.
Very good. My husband liked it a lot. I will add boiled eggs next time.
Instead of white vinegar we added Italian salad dressing, only 1/4 cup sugar and extra 1/4 cup mayo.
I cut the sugar back a tad, but the flavour is nice.
Way too much Sugar....family did not like this. Wont make again!
Made a Mac Salad using this recipe as a base and added some chopped up thick sliced bacon and ancho chili powder. Was a huge hit!

Thank you!! I needed a starter recipe for macaroni salad & this was perfect. I chose to grate all the veggies to add their flavor & beautiful color without having the individual pieces outshine the deliciousness of the dressing. I also dissolved the sugar in the vinegar before incorporating into mayo mixture. I definitely recommend refrigerating for about 4 hours to allow all the flavors to come together. I added small cubes of cooked ham & grated sharp cheddar bc that’s the type of mac salad I wanted. Greatly appreciate this recipe. Very versatile. My family throughly enjoyed.
Love this recipe. I make it at least once a month.
everyone loved it

This is fantastic, here are the tweaks I made. I substituted celery salt for the celery, left out the pimentos, and grated the onion instead of chopped. For the sugar I used nearly half and it was good for me. I also cut the recipe in half because there's just two of us, so 8oz (2 cups) macaroni and half all the other ingredients.

I'll give this a solid 4 stars. I'd rather give it 4 1/2, but alas ... Anyhow, I keep looking for good, old fashioned-type macaroni salad recipes that don't have eggs in them. The husband developed an allergy to eggs several years ago, and it's been kind of a pain in the neck. I really miss macaroni salad with eggs in it. Anyhow, I gave this one a try, using very large elbow macaroni, and it was pretty darn good. It's a sweeter one, as opposed to a savory salad, so it was a very good side to have with ham we had for dinner. I think it would be a good addition to any picnic table, cook out, or barbecue as the mild flavors would complement, and not detract from, the main course. I let it chill in the refrigerator for several hours, but am eager to see how it will taste tomorrow. I would make this again as I continue my search.
Love the salad ingredients, but it was way to sweet, I will start with 1/4 cup next time.
When first mixed together it smells like vinegar but I guess we’ll find out tomorrow. First recipe I’ve used that hasn’t been family’s.

Best macaroni salad I have ever made. Did take more mayo then recipe called for

Came out amazing! Will definitely be making again and its simple

I avoided that because it sounded like dessert. This was even sweeter. Am sure with much less sugar, it would be a good recipe. I learned my lesson about reading the reviews first.

This is exactly the flavor I was looking for! I wanted to find something similar to Deli style and did not change a thing in the recipe. I wanted to test is for an Easter get together and now I will have to make a second batch closer to the event. LOL A little sweet with a little tang. PERFECT!

I read the other reviews and made sure to reduce the amount of sugar but otherwise I kept everything else the same (I didn't have any celery but doubt it was missed). It tastes so good and for me, even better the following day. This is going to be my go to recipe from now on. I highly recommend!

This a an awesome macaroni salad have made it several times I didn’t have enough regular Hellman’s may so I used Hellman’s Mayo and olive oil, instead of pimento I used red bell pepper and chopped up boiled egg
good !!!! just added a little dijon mustard
